Proof of Angle Sum Theorem

by David W Shao

Angle Sum Theorem

The sum of the measures of the interior
angles of a triangle is 180°

If a straight line stands on a straight line, then it makes either two right angles or angles whose sum equals two right angles.

Vertical Angles Are Congurent

Angles A and B are a pair of vertical angles
angles C and D are a pair of vertical angles.

Parallel Postulate

if the sum of the interior angles α and β is less than 180°, the two straight lines, produced indefinitely, meet on that side

Corresponding Angle Postulate

Two lines are parallel if and only if the two angles of any pair of corresponding angles of any transversal are congruent

A direct consequence of "Parallel Postulate"
